intro: Dichromena unicolor, commonly known as the single-colored dichromena, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically display a single color, often in shades of red or purple. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticulturists.
